their search results. I'm just curious whether it's possible, even if you have consumers' best interests at heart, that you might actually be doing harm to the broader field of tech innovation? If Google Inc. as a search engine loses sight of what users really want, I'm sure there will be enough companies out there willing to fulfill that need. That's why competition is such a good thing. It keeps everyone honest, and clearly it keeps every company involved focused on the users. I believe a competitive landscape, an open market, allows Google Inc. and other companies to do the right things for their users, because it's in their best interests when users are happy with the product. Egypt's top archaeologist, Zahi Hawass , told state television Egyptians on the street had tried to protect the building, but that the looters had entered from above. Two mummies on display had been damaged. I felt deeply sorry... when I came this morning to the Egyptian Museum and found that some had tried to raid the museum by force last night, Zahi Hawass , chairman of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, said.
